form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Expressing support for the designation of July 2025 as National Sarcoma Awareness Month.

whereas.text: Whereas sarcoma is a rare cancer of the bones or connective tissues, such as nerves, muscles, joints, fat, and blood vessels, that can arise nearly anywhere in the body;

paragraph.text: about 17,000 individuals are diagnosed with sarcoma each year;
approximately 7,600 individuals die from sarcoma each year; and
about 50,000 individuals struggle with sarcoma at any given time;

whereas.text: Whereas, each year, about 1 percent of cancers diagnosed in adults and around 15 percent of cancers diagnosed in children are sarcoma;
Whereas more than 70 subtypes of sarcoma have been identified;
Whereas the potential causes of sarcoma are not well understood;
Whereas treatment for sarcoma can include surgery, radiation therapy, or chemotherapy;
Whereas sarcoma is often misdiagnosed and underreported; and
Whereas July 2025 would be an appropriate month to designate as National Sarcoma Awareness Month—

paragraph.text: to raise awareness about sarcoma; and
to encourage more individuals in the United States to get properly diagnosed and treated: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That the Senate supports the designation of July 2025 as National Sarcoma Awareness Month.
